item.title: Natasia add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "I will not wait to love as best as I can. We thought we were young and that there would be time to love well sometime in the future. This is a terrible way to think. It is no way to live, to wait to love." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Natasia add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "But my body was like a harp and her words and gestures were like fingers running upon the wires." -- James Joyce

item.title: Natasia add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Natasia add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "That is part of the beauty of all literature. You discover that your longings are universal longings, that you're not lonely and isolated from anyone. You belong." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Natasia add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Natasia add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I have always lived violently, drunk hugely, eaten too much or not at all, slept around the clock or missed two nights of sleeping, worked too hard and too long in glory, or slobbed for a time in utter laziness. I've lifted, pulled, chopped, climbed, made love with joy and taken my hangovers as a consequence, not as a punishment." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Natasia add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I am happy to report that in the war between reality and romance, reality is not the stronger." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Do you have doubts about life? Are you unsure if it's worth the trouble? Look at the sky: that is for you. Look at each person's face as you pass on the street: those faces are for you. And the street itself, and the ground under the street and the ball of fire underneath the ground: all these things are for you. They are as much for you as they are for other people. Remember this when you wake up in the morning and think you have nothing. Stand up and face the east. Now praise the sky and praise the light within each person under the sky. It's okay to be unsure. But praise, praise, praise." -- Miranda July

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Everything is the way it is because everything was the way it was. Sometimes I feel ensnared in this, as if no matter what I do, what will come has already been fixed." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I am always sad, I think. Perhaps this signifies that I am not sad at all, because sadness is something lower than your normal disposition, and I am always the same thing. Perhaps I am the only person in the world, then, who never becomes sad. Perhaps I am lucky." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I hated myself for going, why couldn't I be the kind of person who stays?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "And here I am, instead of there. I'm sitting in this library, thousands of miles from my life, writing another letter I know I won't be able to send, no matter how hard I try and how much I want to. How did that boy making love behind that shed become this man writing this letter at this table?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Natasia add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Natasia add a quote by e.e. Cummings
item.description: "I like my body when it is with your body. It is so quite new a thing. Muscles better and nerves more." -- e.e. Cummings

item.title: Natasia add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "I like not only to be loved, but also to be told that I am loved. I am not sure that you are of the same mind. But the realm of silence is large enough beyond the grave. This is the world of light and speech, and I shall take leave to tell you that you are very dear." -- George Eliot

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Natasia add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Natasia add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation." "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you." -- Charlotte Brontë
